metadata.title: RA Family: Am I correct in thinking that in order to obtain a 48-MHz USB clock, a 12-MHz resonator must be used?

sections.content:
Question:
Am I correct in thinking that in order to obtain a 48-MHz USB clock, a 12-MHz resonator must be used? 
Answer:
(1) in the case of using RA2A1 MCU
Since USB clock uses HOCO as the clock source, use any clock.
(2) in the case of using RA6M1/RA6M2/RA6M3 MCU
When using USB boot, connect an oscillator of 8, 10, 12, 15, 16, 20 or 24-MHz resonator to the main clock oscillator.
When not using USB boot, any clock that can generate a 48-MHz USB clock is fine. It does not necessarily have to be 12-MHz.
(3) in the case of using RA6M4/RA6M5/RA4M2/RA4M3 MCU
When using USB boot, connect an oscillator of 8, 10, 16, 20 or 24-MHz resonator to the main clock oscillator.
When not using USB boot, any clock that can generate a 48-MHz USB clock is fine. It does not necessarily have to be 12-MHz.
(4) in the case of using RA4W1/RA4M1 MCU
When using USB as a device controller, the USB clock uses HOCO as the clock source, so use any clock.
When using USB as a host controller, any clock that can generate a 48-MHz USB clock is fine. It does not necessarily have to be 12-MHz. 
Suitable Products
RA2A1, RA4M1, RA6M1, RA6M2, RA6M3, RA4W1, RA6M4, RA6M5, RA4M2, RA4M3
